body:
### Problem

I would like to  contribute to C code (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32616) but I have an issue with uncrustify:

```
âžœ make lint
[  0%] Performing install step for 'uncrustify'
[  0%] Generating version header
-- Unable to determine version from source tree; fallback version '0.80.1_f' will be used
-- (This is normal if you are building from a zip / tarball)
[  0%] Built target generate_version_header
[100%] Built target uncrustify
Install the project...
-- Install configuration: "Release"
CMake Error at cmake_install.cmake:52 (file):
  file INSTALL cannot find "/home/teto/neovim/build/usr/bin/uncrustify": No
  such file or directory.
```

the errors at cmake_install.cmake:52
 ```
if(NOT DEFINED CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX)
  set(CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX "/home/teto/neovim/build/usr")
endif()
string(REGEX REPLACE "/$" "" CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}")

...

  file(INSTALL DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}/bin" TYPE EXECUTABLE FILES "/home/teto/neovim/build/usr/bin/uncrustify")   # <<- here
```
The file /home/teto/neovim/build/usr/bin/uncrustify doesn't exist which seems to trigger the error ? also it might be  a bit tautological as if CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX and I understand correctly it seems to install the file to its existing location ? I tried to find for an uncrustify executable but seems like the linking never completed ? (tried `fd -uL uncrustify` ) would like to log the commands at cmake_install.cmake.

### Steps to reproduce

this happens in a nix shell.
```
$ nix develop github:nix-community/neovim-nightly-overlay
$ rm -rf build CMakeCache.txt
$ cmakeConfigurePhase # calls cmake with some nix settings
$ make
```
dundargoc already gave it a spin and it was fine on darwin ? just not fine on linux.

### Expected behavior

I am ok with a hack like providing my own uncrustiy (nixpkgs provides one) but I suspect the whole deps thing is intertwined in the build system and I am not sure I can skip those. How would I call uncrustify bypassing the Makefile ?

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

master

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

nope

### Operating system/version

nixos unstable

### Terminal name/version

kitty

### $TERM environment variable

kitty

### Installation

nixpkgs
